result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Merrill Newlun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to DOC. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to DOC.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Not to possess or consume alcohol.
No controlled substances without a prescription.
Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting.  
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must follow thru with any programming required by DOC.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

01:45 PM Defendant Timothy Merrill Newlun in court with attorney Renee M Taber. Prosecuting Atty Benjamin James Webster appeared for State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk.  1:57 recess.  2:13 pm back on the record.
CT makes clarification that the charge is as a repeater, NOT 2nd & subsequent offense.  

Not elig for CIP, elig for SA pgm.  8 yr WSP, 3 yr IC & 5 yr ES.  265 days credit.  Follow thru w/ any programming required by DOC.  NO contact w/ known users/dealers.  AS.  No alcohol.  No controlled substances w/o prescription.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  $290.60 fine.  To be paid during term of ES.  FTP-judgment.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.  Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  Def remanded to Dodge Correctional for intake.  PCR.  3:43 pm adj.
